artist: Artist: Katsushika Hokusai; Publisher: Nishimuraya Yohachi
dimension:
9 11/16 × 14 7/16 in. (24.6 × 36.7 cm) (image, sheet, horizontal ōban)
19 × 23 × 1 1/2 in. (48.26 × 58.42 × 3.81 cm) (outer frame)
markings: censor seal: kiwame 極; publisher\'s seal: Eijudō 永寿堂
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled series known as Large Flowers
signed: 前北斎為一筆 {Saki no Hokusai Iitsu hitsu}
text: Imported from China in the 8th or 9th century, the chrysanthemum (kiku) has been an abiding motif in the work of Japanese poets, painters, and textile designers. The imperial family adopted the chrysanthemum as its official emblem. Hokusai, interestingly, paired his chrysanthemums with a common horsefly (abu), perhaps implying his independence from the flower’s august history.
title: Chrysanthemums and Horsefly
